metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16883 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
sssd versions from 1.13.0 to before 2.0.0 did not properly restrict access to the infopipe according to the "allowed_uids" configuration parameter. If sensitive information were stored in the user directory, this could be inadvertently disclosed to local attackers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libnss-sss - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libpam-sss - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libsss-certmap0 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libsss-idmap0 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libsss-simpleifp0 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
libsss-sudo - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
python3-sss - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-ad - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-ad-common - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-common - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-dbus - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-idp - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-ipa - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-kcm - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-krb5 - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-krb5-common - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-ldap - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-proxy - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
sssd-tools - 2.7.3-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in 2.0.0 during code refactor as of 2021-08-18, no minimal fixes available

criterions.comment: sssd package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.3-2ubuntu2').
